alert.note: Alert for Boyd; Carter; Greenup; Lawrence (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 18 at 4:50PM EDT until July 18 at 5:15PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: The National Weather Service in Charleston West Virginia has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southwestern Boyd County in northeastern Kentucky... Southwestern Greenup County in northeastern Kentucky... Lawrence County in northeastern Kentucky... Carter County in northeastern Kentucky... * Until 515 PM EDT. * At 449 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Farley, or 8 miles southwest of Olive Hill, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Grayson, Olive Hill, Blaine, Grayson Lake State Park, Yatesville Lake State Park, Carter Caves State Park, Webbville, Denton, Gesling, Greenbo Lake, Oldtown, Martha, Rush, Load, Ulysses, Charley, Carter, Brushart, Hitchins and Warnock. This includes Interstate 64 in Kentucky between mile markers 149 and 180. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
